about.description: I am a frontend developer from Rosenheim (Bavaria) with a focus on clean structures, modern UI, and maintainable code. I am passionate about combining design and technology, creating solutions that not only work but also feel intuitive and high-quality. In my projects I work with Angular, TypeScript, HTML, and SCSS, placing strong emphasis on clear components, readable code, and a great user experience. I work in a structured way, enjoy learning new things, and value honest feedback, both within a team and throughout the development process.
about.locationInfo: I am based in Rosenheim (Bavaria) and mainly work remotely. I am also open to international collaboration.
about.mindset: I enjoy learning new things, experimenting, and continuously improving step by step, not out of obligation, but out of genuine curiosity.
about.workStyle: I approach problems in a solution-oriented and logical way. Research, collaboration, and learning from mistakes help me make things clearer, simpler, and more effective.

skills.description: I work with modern frontend technologies to build structured and responsive web interfaces. I focus on clean code, reusability, and clear, maintainable solutions.
skills.offer2: I continuously expand my skill set and enjoy diving into new technologies.
skills.offer3: Do you have an idea or project? I’d love to hear from you.

projects.description: Explore a selection of my projects and interact with them to see my skills in action.

projectDescriptions.join: Join is a web-based task management tool built around the Kanban principle. Tasks can be created, organized, and moved through different workflow stages.
projectDescriptions.pokedex: In this project I built an interactive Pokédex web app. Users can browse Pokémon, apply filters, and view detailed information.
projectDescriptions.instagram: In this project I recreated Instagram’s design in the frontend as closely as possible. The focus was on UI implementation; likes and comments are stored locally in the browser.
projectDescriptions.pollo: In this project I built a classic jump-and-run game using JavaScript. The focus was on game logic, collisions, animations, and smooth gameplay in the browser.

0.text: Julia is exceptionally calm. She takes time to truly understand problems and analyze them thoroughly which is incredibly important in this field.
0.author: E. Ertuk – Project partner

1.text: If something doesn’t work right away, Julia stays calm and looks for a good solution. She experiments, asks questions, and ultimately brings order to chaos.
1.author: P. Weiss – Project partner

2.text: Julia is very curious and keeps going until she truly understands things. You can tell she genuinely wants to improve and that’s contagious.
2.author: K. Ekhart – Mentor

3.text: Working together was open and straightforward. Julia communicates clearly, listens well, and makes collaboration easy.
3.author: F. Szceric – Project partner

contact.description: Whether you have a specific project in mind or are still shaping your ideas:
contact.description2: feel free to get in touch. I look forward to the conversation.
contact.name: Name
contact.hintName: Oops! It semmes like your name is missing.
contact.hintText: What do you need to develop?
contact.privacy3: and agree to the processing of my data as outlined.

section1.title: 1. Controller
section1.line1: The controller responsible for data processing on this website is:
section1.name: Julia Schäffer

section2.title: 2. General Information
section2.p1: The protection of your personal data is important to me.
section2.p2: I process personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and applicable German data protection laws.
section2.p3: This privacy policy explains which data is collected on this website and for what purpose.

section3.title: 3. Contact Form
section3.intro: When you contact me via the contact form, the data you provide will be processed.
section3.purpose: The data is processed solely to handle your inquiry and possible follow-up questions.
section3.storage: The data will be deleted once it is no longer required for the purpose of processing and no legal retention obligations apply.
section3.sharing: Your data will not be shared with third parties.

section4.title: 4. Hosting
section4.logIntro: The hosting provider automatically collects information in so-called server log files, including:
section4.purpose: This data is processed to ensure the proper functioning and security of the website.

section5.title: 5. Server Log Files
section5.p1: The hosting provider automatically collects and stores information transmitted by your browser.
section5.p2: This data cannot be assigned to specific individuals and is not merged with other data sources.

section6.title: 6. Cookies and Tracking
section6.text: This website does not use cookies or tracking tools.

section7.title: 7. Google Fonts
section7.p1: Google Fonts are used locally on this website.
section7.p2: The fonts are hosted on the server itself, so no connection to Google servers is established.
section7.p3: No personal data is transmitted to Google.

section8.title: 8. Your Rights
section8.complaint: You also have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.

section9.title: 9. Data Security
section9.text: This website uses SSL/TLS encryption to protect transmitted data from unauthorized access.

section2.title: Terms of Use
section2.p1: This website is a personal, non-commercial portfolio.
section2.p2: All content is provided for informational purposes only.
section2.p3: Using this website does not create any contractual relationship.

section3.title: About This Website
section3.p1: This portfolio was created as part of my training as a frontend developer.
section3.p2: It showcases a selection of my projects, skills, and approach to work.

section4.title: Technology
section4.p1: This website was built with Angular, TypeScript, and SCSS, following responsive web design principles.

section5.title: Credits
section5.p1: Design and development: Developer Akademie & Julia Schäffer.
section5.p2: Icons and fonts are used in accordance with their respective licenses.
